1.text: Check the ginger for softness or moistness.

2.text: Square up the edges using a chef’s knife.

3.text: Peel the ginger with a paring knife or vegetable peeler.

4.text: Freeze the ginger so it’s easier to grate.

5.text: Find a grater with a large surface area and fine etched holes.

6.text: Hold the peeled ginger root so the fibers are perpendicular to the grater.

7.text: Drag the root against the grain of the grater.

8.text: Lay a fork down on the cutting board.

9.text: Rub peeled ginger across the tines of the fork.

10.text: Pull the ginger in all directions.
